channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Rubbish fly tipped on private open space, 19th December
item.description:
A shopping trolley full of rubbish bags has been dumped next to recycling bins on the private land of two blocks of flats. More rubbish bags, garden waste and other items have also been left on the floor surrounding these bins
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wessex Drive, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electric recycling bin, 19th December
item.description:
Electric recycling bins being used for everyday waste. They are not being used for recycling. I did report this but nothing been done. The are rodents and fox's now ripping bags.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gallions Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street and pavement sweeping, 19th December
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to request that street cleaning be reinstated on Kingswood Drive SE19. Although the street is included in the council‚Äôs leaf-cleaning schedule, (week 2) the even-numbered houses are located on a (council-owned )spur road. See the map you can clearly see that Kingswood Drive is split in two with the even numbered houses off the spur road and is a cul de sac. As such, responsibility for cleaning this section rests with the council. Despite this, the spur road has not been cleaned for at least six months. This issue was previously reported, and cleaning did resume for a short period, but it appears to have once again been removed from the

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hogarth Court, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road full of pothole, 19th December
item.description:
Hello, Shepard Hill in Haringay is full of potholes before reaching Wolseley Road; it's very bad, and I saw a car broken down. The driver says it's the pothole that just spoiled his car tyres There's no garage in the area so it's very dangerous for people who drive at night; the pothole spoil their car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 62,64, Wolseley Road, Crouch End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walk through in our cul de sac, 19th December
item.description:
Hi We have filthy delivery men of all companies driving in to our cul de sac and urinating in the gap land next to our houses, not only is it unpleasant, but children from the local Primary School (across the road) use it, can you imagine a young child coming face to face with a man stood there Penis in hand, it‚Äôs appalling it really is. Can anybody do something please to stop these awful men using our cul de sac as a public loo Please üôèüèª
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arnold Avenue West, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish littering street / covered in detritus, 19th December
item.description:
Rubbish covered Street between Combermere rd and Argyll close. The litter has been here for weeks. Little pickers are not covering this area effectively. Detritus has been here for a long time. Regular street cleaning not taking place. Surrounding roads similarly affected
